page.title: 05A Martinstown Family
page.content: Mary Bowering was born in 1922, the eleventh child of a Martinstown family. Both her grandfather and her cousin were custodians of Maiden Castle, the ancient hillfort dominating the landscape, and her father was a hedger and ditcher, an occupation now sadly disappeared. Her childhood was different to that described by grandaughter Lucy. Life was harder, quieter,Mary's mother used to take in washing from the bigger houses and sometimes cooked too. Pastimes centred around the village. Children begged rides from farm carts (then the main traffic), collected the registration numbers of the still uncommon cars that occasionally drove by or played guessing games. A charabanc trip to Portland was special. Mary's mother was sure it would crash driving down Fortuneswell.
